Josephine’s story is a powerful reminder that there are many Americans living today who were born without the rights that we so often take for granted. The arc of justice is not a given — we must never stop working for a nation in which we are all truly equal under the law. #VA07

Josephine has stood witness to decades of change in our country. She’s lived through dozens of elections and still remembers firsthand a time when poll taxes were used to block Black Americans from exercising their right to vote.
Josephine was born in Maidens Virginia in 1918. Growing up she attended a one-room school and as the seventh of 13 children the house her father built for their family was always full.
